Reviews.Title: “Four Day weekend”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelingTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I'm a retired (25 yr) Travel Consultant and I always do my homework before booking a hotel. First you must know what you are looking for. The Hotel Suisse is in a perfect location, just a short walk up the street to the Spanish Steps. The hotel is located on a very narrow side street in an old (hello, it's ancient Rome) building. The hotel is located on the third floor and has an elevator for easy access. I would compare the Hotel more to a bed and reakfast than a hotel. Our room was small, we had a double bed as requested, it was comfortable for my husband but I like a softer mattress, still I slept OK due to lots of walking all day long. The bathroom was also small but very functional with soaps, shampoo, and a hairdryer. The bedding was good and the towels were nice. Everything was spotlessly clean, the staff was friendly and helpful and spoke great English. The TV also had two English channels, BBC, & CNN (yuk, but better than nothing). A light Continental Breakfast was was delivered to our room in five minutes after a quick phone call requesting it when ready every morning. Overall the Hotel Suisse is Charming, for us it was a great value, and we would definately stay there again. I do however recommend that you have the hotel arrange for a private driver (round trip), he will meet you at the airport outside baggage claim and drop you right in front of the hotel. The cost is Euro 50.00 each way but worth every penny, it is a 45 minute ride from the airport, traffic is bizzar to put it mildly. We have lived in Europe for 5 years and I would not recommend driving inside the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a good location”
Reviews.Author: MS M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suisse was a very difficult hotel to find (I suggest that you book the hotel driver) - but once there the location of the hotel was very good. It is approximately 100 metres from the top of the Spanish steps and a very short walk to the Trevi Fountain. The hotel service was good and the rooms were very comfortable and clean, with a modern bathroom. It was good value considering its location. However, be warned that the rooms are very noisy from the street noise outside. Even though the hotel is on the 5th floor - the road outside has lots of passersby talking loudly late in the night. A problem for light sleepers or families with chidren. The breakfast served was all that is needed to get started in the mornings (bread basket with butter and jams, yoghurt, orange and coffee and tea). However you have no other options at the hotel (more of a bed and Breakfast) for food and need to head outside for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: P201011
Reviews.Content: It's a old Rome building, the enviornment just like a bed and breakfast but it have room services and house keeping every day. I like the furniture and the decoratation, bed is ok. Shower room is really small, hardly get in if you're fat! no tooth paste and no shower gel. The breakfast lady is very nice, breakfast is continental, don't expect ham and egg. Overall, I like it the convenient location and the traditional old style and we feel cozy during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible value for money”
Reviews.Author: Elad L
Reviews.Content: We reserved the hotel after reading the spec as presented in the Hotel web-site by the owner (Dora), and she declare that all rooms are with central heating, and some of them have double bed (while the others have 2 separate beds). We placed the order asking for a double bed, and stated that we are on our honeymoon. As we arrived to the hotel we found out that the central heating is out of order, and that we have 2 separate beds. We asked Dora about it, and she explained that the central heating is on from 01.11.11, and that the hotel doesn't have double beds room, so it must be a mistake on the web-site... We spent the night, freezing, and on 07:00 we were amazed to wake up to hammering and drilling sounds. When we went to the front desk to complain to Dora (the owner), she said there are renovations at the top floor and she can do nothing about it, and about the heating, she came up with an old radiator…. We tried to explain that if she would have mentioned the renovations, we would pick another place… she nodded, and said that it's "not a nice thing to write on the web-site"…. I said that all and all the place doesn't worth the price (similar to other hotels in the neighborhood), and she should move us to another room (though all rooms suffers from the noise as far as I understand and verify with other guests), or make us a discount considering the circumstances. She refused, and promised to talk to the workers, and make sure the noise won't begin till 8:00 o'clock (AM) -I said that 08:00 o'clock on vacation is very early, trying to urged her to realize the problem depth. The next morning we woke up to the same symphony, at approximately the same time (07:00)..... On the other hand, The hotel location is the best one can imagine (right at the Spanish stairs), and the staff working there is helpfull and kind (excluding the owner).

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfortable hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: MJF10
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Suisse in Rome, Italy. My husband and I enjoyed this hotel experience. The location near the Spanish steps is very convenient to walk to all the local sights. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful especially Dora, the proprietor. We were able to check in early and were provided with information about the area and a map to assist with sightseeing. The hotel has an elevator and in room continental breakfast. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: traveller_184
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suisse was great value for money! The location was great, right behind the spanish steps. The room was comfortable, quite a good size. The bathroom was great, though the shower was tiny! The breakfast was average. The housekeeper brings it to your room each morning - freashly squeezed juice which is great and a basket of crossiants/toast. There was no internet in our room but there is in the lounge - though the connection is terrible! But that wasn't really an issue as we were there to explore ROMA. As we checked out in the morning and our flight wasn't until the afternoon, the manager allowed us to shower in the bathroom off the hallway with no extra charge- which was great after spending the day in Rome's heat! Very kind. All in all - we loved Hotel Suisse. See you again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Spring In Rome's Hotel Suisse”
Reviews.Author: CJG4
Reviews.Content: This was our 25th wedding anniversary trip that we took in May of 2011. The hotel was located about a city block from the Spanish steps and in a small cobbled street, that looked like an alley, but most do. I felt safe in the hotel and they kept everything securely locked. The room was nice sized with 2 shuttered windows overlooking a garden area that was surrounded by other buildings, possibly apartments. We could hear these incredible sounding birds each morning and it was really kind of neat. The room itself was nice size, clean, hard bed with a 13 inch small old tv. I wasn't in Italy to watch tv so really could care less. The bathroom had a little shuttered balcony overlooking the same garden area. The shower is extremely small and I'm an average sized woman. I dropped my bar of soap and literally had to step out to pick it up. My hint of the day was to make sure the balcony doors are shut. The staff were very nice and breakfast your typical very small cappuccino, oj and croissant. There was this small jazz club next door that was really pretty cool. The night we went they had a small group of musicians that sounded and looked like they'd just stepped out of the 50's and were incredible. I thought the Spanish step area at night had a very carnival atmosphere and there were several nigerians trying to sell glow sticks, bouncing lite up balls and it was a little too much. The walking distance was not too far to get to the Presidents palace, Pantheon and Tevi Fountain. Basically you get what you pay for and when I go back to Rome I would pay the extra and stay in the Pantheon area. Full of musicians, outdoor restaurants, etc. It was really the neatest spot in my opinion for Rome tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Secure and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ourdream2
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in great and wonderful location to the Spanish steps. The room and bathroom are very clean. All The ladies staff are nice and cooperative specially the lady working in the kitchen is very hard working and responding to our request instantly. However, one of the receptionist is curious and asking many personal questions and asked us to leave our passports for completing the check-in but we asked him to complete this job to take our passports before checking-in. Hotel kindly accepted keeping our luggage in the Hotel's storage till our return back from other city. The hotel is secured with large wooden front door which is closing automatically at 8 pm and opened with a ring bill. You feel like home and we liked it. The breakfast good and fresh but it needs to add some more. The last night we checked-out early morning and we didn't get our breakfast in compare to other hotels which packed the breakfast for us.The lift is very small and slow. The walls need to be acoustically treated because you can hear every thing outside the room even the foot steps. All in all this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TMH05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Suisse in July of 2011. The hotel room appeared nicer on the website than it did in person, but it was clean. The shower was very small. The hotel was in a fabulous location for site seeing around Rome. The workers were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was served in our room each morning. One morning, we left earlier than when breakfast was served, and they had us a "to-go" bag ready. Tips for getting there from the Spagna Metro stop: Take the elevator located in the Metro station so you do not have to walk up the Spanish Steps. When you get off the elevator and go out to the street, turn and face the church and walk right.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mana2000
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel very huge room it was told that was the biggest room in the hotel upon spanish steps and near shopping center very simple breakfast (almost nothing) very friendly staff and with very odd security

Reviews.Title: “Overall an okay experience but just not worth €150 per night.”
Reviews.Author: CiaranHughes
Reviews.Content: After checking in we were given a small dark room - I had booked the room months in advance and expected better, this was definitely not what is shown on the hotel website or Tripadvisor photos. The room we moved to was better however the bathroom was very small with old facilities. On the plus side the location is very good and the hotel is safe and quiet, breakfast was good but served in the room. Overall an okay experience but just not worth €150 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sylmar
Reviews.Content: Felt very safe at that hotel as a single traveler and liked the idea that you had to be buzzed in. Room was spacious, overlooking a courtyard. Was very quiet. I enjoyed having breakfast brought to room, so I could have breakfast first and then get ready. Staff was very friendly. You can also buy beverages (mineral water, wine, etc.) at a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dora_and_Map
Reviews.Content: An absolutely perfect location for exploring the city being very close to the Spanish Steps. Cosy hotel - feels like you are living with a family. Friendly and helpful staff. Despite being in such a central area, it was very quiet. Free wi-fi in the lounge should be extended to the rooms. Heating was on a timer and was turned off early in the morning so the room felt chilly. The staff explained that the central heating timer was not in their control, therefore there wasn't much they could do about it. Although breakfast was included in the room rate, it is rather basic (bread rolls, juice, tea/coffee) and served in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Eron03SanDiego
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spend 5 nights at the Hotel Suisse. We could not have been more pleased with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The hotel is in a very nice location, has free access to their computer in the lounge, and has an elevator (the hotel is actually on the 3rd floor of an older building). The room we had was spacious and had lots of storage for our clothes. It also had nice lighting over the bed which is a plus for those of us who like to read before nodding off. The bathroom was quite adequate. And it was a good value. All in all, this place is hard to beat for a 3 star in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, quiet and cosy - a smashing little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneyPLondon
Reviews.Content: I took my Dad to Rome for his 70th birthday and I'm so glad we stayed here. We had a walk which took longer than expected from Termini and were a bit frazzled when we arrived. I could see my Dad visibly cheer up, lighten up and chill out as we were greeted warmly by the twinkly owner, and whisked down the parquet-floored corridor to a cozy and charming room. The location is spot on for sightseeing - 2 mins to Spanish Steps, 5 mins from Trevi Fountain and probably 9 mins to Pantheon. But the best thing was how quiet it was. You could hear a pin drop at night (or raindrops - it poured). This was a real find and I'd strongly recommend it. Simple breakfasts are served in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Value, location and charm.”
Reviews.Author: carmensitamarguerita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Suisse for 4 nights in early October with my elderly mother. The hotel is located near the top of the Spanish Steps on a quiet street. You do not have to climb the Spanish Steps as there is an elevator just inside the Spagna Metro station that takes you to the top and very close to to hotel. Alternatively, you can walk past the Spanish Steps to the right, take a side street and approach the hotel from the bottom of Via Gregoriana. It is only a few meters up the street. We were able to walk to most of the major tourist sights and had easy access by Metro to the Vatican. The hotel was right in the middle of abundant shopping and restaurants. I was very pleased with this location. As others have said, the hotel is on the 4th floor of a mixed use building. It is more like a pension. Once inside, the reception and common areas are charming and furnished with antiques. The staff is very helpful and provided assistance with maps and directions, restaurant recommendations and advance ticket reservations for the Vatican museums. We had requested a quiet room facing the inner courtyard and slept very well with our window open at night. The room was spacious (by Rome standards) and we had plenty for room to unpack and stow our luggage. The room was furnished with charming antiques and had a beautiful parquet floor. The bathroom was modern but the shower stall was very small and awkward to get in to. I can see this being a problem for a large person. Continental breakfast was delivered promptly each morning and the OJ was fresh and the cappucino was hot. The price was right in city where hotels can be expensive. I will stay at the Hotel Suisse again when I am next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ViaFaentina
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. We stayed here for 4days with our 3 children (10, 7 & 5yr olds). The location is just perfect, you are literally behind the Spanish Steps, close to the Metro and all of Rome's wonders. Considering location, cleanliness and attentiveness by the staff I would say that the price was fair. Agree that it's more like a b&b than a hotel, but that is not a negative comment. There was always someone available at reception to help with anything we needed and we felt well looked after throughout our stay. Signor Nelson at reception is a gracious and attentive host and helped with all our enquiries. Continental breakfast is ample - the juices and cornetti were fresh each morning and the coffee always delivered hot. Our room was clean, comfortable, air conditioned, furniture very well-maintained & the bathroom big and CLEAN. As for a previous comment regarding noise and uncomfortable beds all I can say is that the 5 of us slept like babies and hey you're in Italy - are you really expecting quiet?? A Wonderful stay at the Hotel Suisse and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: marea1999
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suisse is a charming little hotel just steps away from the Spanish Steps. It was a little difficult to find, initially as they don't have a large sign outside, but it was worth the hunt! Our room was very comfortable with air conditioning that worked well, and a large, spacious bathroom with a small balcony off of it. We were served breakfast (pastry and coffee) in our room as there is no real dining area in the hotel. Everyone there was friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions and tourist attraction ideas. There was always someone at the front desk, which gave us a nice sense of security. We really enjoyed our time at the Hotel Suisse for it's friendly staff and wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that's easy on the pocket book”
Reviews.Author: can1003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Suisse for 4 nights in May. This is not your typical hotel but more like a B&B. Our room was a great size, super clean and the staff were very friendly. The location was amazing near the top of the Spanish Steps. It was about a 2 minute walk to the subway for a 5 min train ride to the coloseum or the Vatican. We walked to the coloseum one day and it took about 20 min. If you are looking for a nice little hotel at a great price compared to others in Rome this is the place. For the room price per night I give this nice little hotel 5 / 5.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the charming Hotel Suisse”
Reviews.Author: skingo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in Hotel Suisse. It was a very charming hotel with friendly and helpful staff. As others have said, the rooms were characterful and spacious and very quiet. The communal areas were also lovely, with quiet areas to sit and read etc. It was in a great location round the corner from the Spanish Steps and within easy walking distance of all the things you want to see in Rome. The only slight criticism is that, although they perfectly clean, the bathroom was a bit old fashioned/basic for our taste. That said I have no hesitation in recommending - we had a lovely time there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: nichole_8
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent boutique hotel. The service was fantastic and friendly. The hotel was simple, and the room was small, but not uncomfortably so. The location and price could not be beat. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Suisse”
Reviews.Author: mtgevntplanner
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Suisse and loved it! We only had two days in Rome and wanted a central location. After searching numerous websites and travel journals, we decided on this hotel and are so glad we did. The Hotel Suisse is located on a quiet street near the top of the Spanish Steps. I don't know what our "neighbors' up the street at the Hassler paid but our room was enormous and reasonably priced for the area. We were traveling with our 4 year old daughter and had plenty of room for the three of us, plus luggage. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The in-room breakfast was delivered within 10 minutes. Choices included assorted breads and croissants. Ask for hot ham and make a sandwich. Wine is available for purchase in the evening. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and felt very secure. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: mingrina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days at the last leg of our 2 week Italian holiday. The room we stayed in was bigger than the average Italian hotel rooms. We were staying in less spacious rooms so the space was a treat. The room was clean and the bed was firm. As we were there in April, the weather was cool and we did not need an air-con. We decided to leave the window ajar on our first night but we had to shut it as our room faced the street and there were merry makers at a pub below. During our stay we were unfortunate that the elevator was out of service and we had to climb 3 stories to get to the hotel. It was only a challenge with our luggage but there was a nice porter who assisted us. The hotel's location is ideal being a 8 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and that's very close to the designer shops too. We would recommend this hotel and we would return for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet central hotel”
Reviews.Author: 100JJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suisse is about 200 metres from the top of the Spanish steps. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The room we had overlooked a private courtyard and was very clean and comfortable. You need to pay extra for air con if its required. It was a pleasent quiet haven away from the busy streets of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for families - a find!”
Reviews.Author: frequent_fam_travel
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to learn about the Hotel Suisse from friends in our hometown and it was such a treat. We loved staying there! The location could not be better and the family room was huge. Our friends stayed at the Hassler during the smae time up the block and our room was 3 times the size. I loved the security the place had as well with only a few guests at a time and our kids loved Rome. The hotel is a little tricky as it is on the second floor of a mixed use building after several design shops. This hotel was the best value of all of the hotels we stayed in on our 3 week trip. I would not go back to Rome and not stay at the Suisse!

Reviews.Title: “OK, no more”
Reviews.Author: cruiser62
Reviews.Content: Maybe by Rome standards hotel offers superb accomodations, but in reality it is Motel 6 at 165 euros per night. The best feature is, of course, location, as well as top notch security. Other than that everything is at the minimally acceptable level. The breakfast is a joke - lots of bread and not much else, with coffee delivered lukewarm. The whole breakfast-in-the-room idea is silly, because there is not enough space to even sit comfortably. Our room (#38) was just big enough for 2 people, but not if you come with your luggage, as most people do. The shower was tiny. If you are more than 200 lb., stay away from this room - you won't fit in the shower. Among the staff Julie was kind and helpful, but the owner herself was rude and aggressive. Her main point in our 5 minute conversation was that she didn't really need us as customers, because she had plenty of permanent ones, and, if we don't like the shower, we "can go to a public bath." I imagine a Motel 6 employee would be fired for such a comment.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE Room!”
Reviews.Author: Kealoha12
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suisse has several things going for it: location, cleanliness, and price. The location was ideal--we walked everywhere except to the Vatican. We had a HUGE room BUT it was facing the street so it got a little noisy sometimes but once we closed our windows, the noise did not bother us. The hotel was SUPER clean especially the bathrooms which I am very particular. The bathroom was modern but the hotel is in an older building which we found very charming. A few things though that may bother some travelers but were ok with us were: you had to tell someone if you were going to be out after 2:00 am so you can be buzzed in. As we were traveling with a toddler it was lights out for us by 9:00. And we felt safe that guests had to be buzzed in. The breakfast had to be taken to your room--I actually liked this because my boys (husband and son) slept in so I can call for breakfast, and its in our room by the time they wake up. We don't have to worry about missing breakfast. You had to climb a few steps before reaching a small elevator. So if you have luggage--be prepared. For the price and location, you cannot beat the Hotel Suisse. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and good price”
Reviews.Author: RainbowIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suisse was extremely central, just a 5 minute walk from the Spanish steps. It is a very secure hotel as you have to be buzzed in twice when you enter and its on the third floor of its building. The staff are polite and friendly. Our room was very small but quiet and extremely clean. The shower was the smallest i have ever seen!! My husband and i were happy enough with the hotel as we weren't expecting much for the price. Its very basic. The only place we felt comfortable was in our room as we didn't think that they had a very welcoming lobby or lounge to relax in. I don't think we would stay there again as it was so basic, if we return to Rome we would rather pay abit more as we missed our comforts!! Great location for tourist attractions and shopping though!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: gendali
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel with an amazing location - close to everything in Rome. It is on a great street - lots of character. The room was on the small side, as we expected. But it was clean, and quiet - no street noise. The breakfast was nice, served quickly in our room every morning. The bread was fresh and coffee good. The shower was small, but there was decent water pressure and hot water. I feel we got our money's worth here and would recomend Suisse to anyone looking for a nice place to stay that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly & great location!”
Reviews.Author: dcherub
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location...very close to Piazza de Spagna & Piazza Barberini. The staff was very friendly ~ Alma, Julie, and Nelson were all wonderful to us! Restaurant recommendations were great, and they were all helpful with directions and any other additional needs for our room. Our room was lovely with some antiques, and the bathroom was ample and very clean. Breakfast was good & served in the room...assortment of fresh rolls & croissants, jams, honey, juices, cappucino, tea, etc...additional items may be ordered as well for a minimal charge. Security is very good, as you must be buzzed in twice before entering. The night receptionist is on until 2 AM. If you will be staying out past that time, you need to let them know in advance. Great value! Thanks to all at the Hotel Suisse for a lovely stay! Dana & Tim

Reviews.Title: “Spanish Steps and Harry's Bar”
Reviews.Author: Isle 'n Sun
Reviews.Content: We stay in ‘0’ star to ‘5’ star hotels. Therefore we attempt to rate the lodging based on how we perceive the ‘value received.’ Answering the question, “Would I go back to the same place again, for a similar price?” This hotel is a solid YES. Great location. On a narrow quiet street approximately 1 block from the Spanish Steps. Very interesting walk to the Vatican too. Through one of the oldest areas of Rome. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were well appointed, clean, and air-conditioned (if you need it). Breakfast was served in the room.. Only disappointment was the lack of in-room refrigerator. We like to keep several bottles of white wine chilled and close by... We would go back to the same hotel and location. When you look at a map and feel that the hotel is a bit north of where you think you want to be. Well, don't think you will be disappointed (if you have good legs and can do some walking). Having been there several times I can not imagine staying in a different area. I love the area for its people, food, shopping and bars (Harry's is 'the best'). Go sit at the bar have some wine and watch/meet new people). I now stop at Harry's every time I'm in Rome (just love the place ($$$$)), Meet you one day on the Spanish Steps or at Harry's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expensive and some restrictions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Near the spanish steps ( thats in the middle of Rome where all points of interest emanate from). The bathroom is pretty good for the standards in Italy. However, I don't think I'll stay there again. If you want to stay out after 2AM you have to tell the door person when you'll come back (how do I know when I'll come back?). You have no key to the entrance of the hotel so everytime you leave and come in they have to buzz you in (which is a bit of a pain, believe me). Personally, I prefer places where I can come in and out whenever I want regardless of the time. After all, I'm on vacation!!! The price is not bad for the location and the place is definitely CLEAN. Its also quiet so this place probably attracts an older cliental (which is what I noticed). But if you're under 50 I would definitely recommend finding another place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Suisse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay at this Hotel which proved to be comfortable, spotlessly clean and a haven from the hectic life of the City. Above all the staff were reallyhelpful, nothing was too much trouble booking restaurants, calling taxis and we felt cared for. We liked having our breakfast served in our room- always arriving exactly at the time we had requested.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jb+nmo
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the bathroom and overall size and cleanliness of the hotel and our room. It definitely had the feeling of being in someone's home. We were a bit disappointed that air conditioning was extra. This is not listed on their website, nor was it mentioned in any of our correspondence. We also found it odd that they ask for 1 night's stay in cash if possible. It felt cheap, especially when we were then asked to go to the local ATM to withdraw cash. They did, however, accept our credit card for payment in full. We would not stay around the area of the Spanish steps nor at this hotel again. Breakfast at the hotel is served in your room which is a bit awkward, and is very simple. Generally, the food in the area of the Spanish steps was lousy. The plus is that it is located very close to the Metro. Overall, I think the reviews regarding this hotel are generous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty nice. We had a huge room with a big bathroom and shower. If you decide to stay here just make sure that you specifically ask not to be placed in room 30. This room, which we stayed in, is right next to the front desk so if anyone calls the hotel, rings up, walks in or out of the hotel...you hear it. The breakfast was good and the staff was nice. They want you to pay at least one nights stay in cash so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love Hotel Suisse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My cousins and I stayed 4 nights in October, 2005. This was my second stay. Our rooms had a TV and ceiling fan. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Julie is great and always has a smile on her face. Very helpful with directions. The location is the best in Rome. Cannot wait to return to Rome, so I can stay at hotel again. Clean, charming, spacious rooms, security.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is excellent in all senses. Clean and comfortable. The service is okey, and the staff are very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Laurence-Stan
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel. It is located at the third floor of an ancient house in a quiet street. When entering the place it feels like being in a private house or a B&B. Nicely decorated with ancient furniture. The room was nice, very clean, with woodfloor. The personnel is very nice. The breakfast is served in the room, perfect for a romantic break. The place is very quiet and very well located, 100m from the Plazza de Spagna and the luxury shops. We stayed there 4 nights and really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: sebinah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Suisse May 22-29, 2005. We found it to be very charming and so close to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The rooms were immaculate and the staff most helpful. Indeed, this hotel added to the pleasure of our trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service/Good Value/good location”
Reviews.Author: Marlin1
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent as service and price was ok. Staff was most helpfull especilly from the front desk lady from the Seychelles as well as Daniella. We had a large room (#34) to the street which was quite noisy (as there is a jazz club on the street level opning till late) but our friends stayed in a room opening to the inner court yard which was fine. Tried a Restaurant near the Trevi Fountain called 'Il Chianti'. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up for Hotel Suisse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days in March, 2005. The staff was very kind, most especially Daniella who had answered my gazillion emails prior to the trip (thank you, Daniella!). The room was a nice size and very clean. The location was wonderful, just beside the Spanish Steps and many shoppes and restaurants. Our room had a shower, as requested, and the water pressure and temperature were fine. Breakfast was served every morning at request, with a quickness, and the housekeeping was superb. Another huge plus for us was that the front desk personnel spoke English and were happy to help us in finding our way around their beautiful city via directions and showing us on the courtesy map provided. I was very happy with the hotel and would easily request a return stay on any future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not bad by european standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Compared to most affordable European hotel rooms, I thought our room was quite spacey. Room to walk around. The bathroom had walk room. I went with my wife, our first trip to Rome. The hotel was the least of our worries. The location is pretty nice. If you have your walking shoes on, there aren't that many things you can't walk to if you have the time, and the weather's nice. Unfortunately when we went (March), it was cold and rained every day. But that's OK too, as there were two subway stops close by, the Spanish Steps metro and the Piazza de Barberini metro. And the subways in Rome are easy to navigate. There's only two lines. If you're in the middle of things, like the Suisse is, it's pretty simple. The only thing I didn't like about the room is that it was cold. I called and asked how to turn up the heat, and the guy told me that it was central heat. It didn't get any warmer, which was kind of a bummer, because it was cold enough that niether of us were quick to jump out of the bed in the morning. The breakfast was kind of so-so, but it was free and you got a couple of good rolls and some coffee. Better than the 8 euros they tried to charge us for the same thing in Paris. There's no TVs, but who cares? We were barely in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome and stayed in at the Suisse Hotel in Dec. of 03. I loved it so much, I plan on staying there again when I go back to Rome in May of 04. Great place, very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our best experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Suisse in September 2004. The hotel was the best thing that happened to us in Rome. Immaculant, quet, location is not more than 200m from Spanish Steps. Our room was small, but the washroom was spotless. And the price we payed was 148 Euros, which is hard to beat for that location. We really liked the in-room breakfast,which was fresh, and you get to even choose items like ham and cheese which are not standard for continental breakfast. I especially loved their capuccino. Strongly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Suisse
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gregoriana 54 | Near Piazza di Spagna, 00187 Rome, Italy
